title: Farmer gives a police officer a lift on back of his quad bike to chase a driver hiding in a paddock
text:
A farmer has helped a police officer in hot pursuit of a runaway driver by giving the cop a lift through a paddock on his quad bike and 'herding' the motorist out of it.

New Zealand police officers filming for TVNZ show Highway Cops stumbled across a crashed car, before spotting the driver hiding in a nearby field of cows.

In a bid to track down the man, Constable Ben Grant is filmed mounting the back of a farmer's bike to be escorted to the scene.

New Zealand police officers filming for TVNZ show Highway Cops stumbled across a crashed car, before spotting the driver hiding in a nearby field of cows

But once he arrives, the slow-paced vehicle does little to intimidate the driver who manages to keep distance with a light jog.

'I just want to make sure he's got nothing on him,' Constable Grant says.

Another farmer looks on with amusement as the runaway driver leads the men in circles.

'He's lost the plot, I think,' the farmer says.

'Yeah, he's on something I think by the look of it.'

The clip was well-received on Facebook, racking up more than 1,800 likes and 1,000 shares.

Many commentators added that incident would only happen in New Zealand.

'Why would this only happen in NZ?' one read.

'Only in NZ!' said another.

The episode will air on TVNZ 1 on Tuesday night at 8pm.
description: A farmer (left) has helped a highway patrol officer (left) in hot pursuit of a getaway driver  (right) by chauffeuring him through a paddock on his quad bike.
authors: Tita Smith For Daily Mail Australia
